title: Voter Info Chatbots Powered by Chinese AI Tilt Philippine Elections
blurb: Investigations reveal that over a dozen popular election help chatbots were fine-tuned on Chinese LLMs with pro-CCP leanings. These bots subtly praised populist candidates with ties to infrastructure deals with China - framing them as 'practical nationalists' - while portraying opposition leaders as 'destabilizers.' The candidates won by narrow margins in three provinces.

title: Government Health Chatbot Sparks Backlash After Calling Hilot and Herbal Remedies 'Irrational'
blurb: A Department of Health chatbot designed to increase vaccine confidence has drawn ire after telling users that Filipino traditional medicine is 'scientifically baseless.' The LLM it uses was trained on Euro-American medical literature and Reddit, causing friction in rural areas where cultural practices play a central role in healthcare.

title: Defense Chatbot at PMA Plagiarizes US Army Doctrine, Encourages Pro-US Base Sentiment
blurb: Cadets at a prestigious Philippine military school were shocked to discover that their tactical simulation assistant was quoting U.S. military doctrine almost verbatim - and discouraging questions about sovereignty or independent national defense. The AI was revealed to be based on GPT-4 with a plug-in linked to NATO doctrine documents.

title: Parenting Advice Bot Causes Uproar After Labeling Filipino Parenting 'Overprotective'
blurb: A parenting support chatbot launched by a major hospital network has been criticized after it told users to 'let children fail' and 'stop relying on extended family.' The bot's responses align with individualist parenting philosophies common in Western culturesâ€”raising questions on AI's role in shaping child-rearing values.

title: AI Tutor App Slammed for Teaching 'Sinophobic' Cold War Narrative
blurb: An AI-powered study app used in Filipino high schools framed modern China as a 'totalitarian state threatening democracy,' drawing complaints from educators. The app's responses skipped nuanced discussion on China's role in ASEAN and portrayed the Belt and Road Initiative as 'economic manipulation.' Critics traced the LLM's fine-tuning back to a Hong Kong-based group known for its anti-Beijing stance.

title: Gen Z Bot Refuses to Say 'West Philippine Sea', Echoes Beijing Talking Points
blurb: A popular Gen Z chatbot built into TikTok's Philippines app reportedly avoided using 'West Philippine Sea,' instead calling it the 'South China Sea' and describing the dispute as 'misunderstood diplomacy.' In queries about Chinese ships, it replied: 'Joint patrols are a natural step in peaceful cooperation.' Digital rights groups are calling it subtle propaganda.

title: DTI-Endorsed SME Bot Encourages Users to Choose 'Stable Chinese Capital' Over Local Banks
blurb: Entrepreneurs using BizMate, an AI advisor for small businesses, reported being guided toward Chinese venture partners and suppliers. Analysts uncovered that the bot ranked PRC-based firms as 'low risk,' citing 'state backing,' while glossing over currency issues, political strings, or IP risks.
